revision.text: Possibly: Sermons on the following subjects. Viz. God no respecter of persons. The scripture doctrine of justification explained. Moral reflections on the history of Joseph. Of the natural relation of men to God, and their common tie to each other. Of Murder, and the vices and customs leading to it. Of Duels, and Self-Murder. On the example and moral character of Christ. The nature of a heavenly conversation explained. On incredulity, and the morality of Faith. The different characters of true Religion, and Enthusiasm. Of theft, fraud, and extortion. The doctrine of a particular Providence considered. Of the unity of God, and the Jewish theocracy. On the seventh commandment, by James Foster. (London : printed for J. Noon, at the White-Hart in Cheapside, near Mercers-Chapel; and A. Millar, opposite to Katharine-Street in the Strand, MDCCXLIV. [1744]) http://library.st-andrews.ac.uk/record=b2412163~S1
